page.title: 02THE OLD AND THE NEW
page.content: The area exhibits a kind of split personality. The former industrial communities are jealous of their origins. The residents of Horsehay will claim it is the only 'village' in Telford. They will then express alarm at the demise of local industry, which forces them to say farewell to their past. In a small survey, carried out in Horsehay and Doseley, it was clear that many of the older folk, who could remember the thriving iron and coal communities of the past, looked upon Telford New Town as a place at best to be avoided. In Little Wenlock, most of the old folk never went to Telford town centre, because the only bus of the week went to Wellington. An old man at New Works, where there is no bus, had never been. Yet amongst younger people, under 40, there was almost universal praise for Telford.
